gurmukhi: ਗਿਰਗਿਟ ਕੈ ਰੰਗ ਕਮਲ ਸਮੇਹ ਬਹੁ ਬਨੁ ਬਨੁ ਡੋਲੈ ਕੳੁਅਾ ਕਹਾ ਧੳੁਸਵਾਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Giragit Kai Rang Kamal Samayh Bahu , Banu Banu Dolai Kauaa Kahaa Dhaousavaan Hai ?
translation: A chameleon who changes the colour of its body so very often looks very much like the form of a lotus flower. But this insect-eating chameleon cannot be holding the merits of a lotus flower. A dead flesh-eating crow that flies here and there cannot reach

gurmukhi: ਘਰ ਘਰ ਫਿਰਤ ਮੰਜਾਰ ਅਹਾਰ ਪਾਵੈ ਬੇਸ੍ਵਾ ਬਿਸਨੀ ਅਨੇਕ ਸਤੀ ਨ ਸਮਾਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Ghar Ghar Dhirat Manjaar Ahaar Paavai , Baysvaa Bisanee Anayk Satee N Samaan Hai ?
translation: Just as a male cat roams about various burrows and houses searching for food, and likewise a whore living life of several vices cannot reach out to a woman of truth, sincerity and virtues.

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਸਰ ਭ੍ਰਮਤ ਨ ਮਿਲਤ ਮਰਾਲ ਮਾਲ ਜੀਵ ਘਾਤ ਕਰਤ ਨ ਮੋਨੀ ਬਗੁ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sar Sar Bhramat N Milat Maraal Maala , Jeev Ghaat Karat N Monee Bagu Dhiaan Hai ?
translation: Just as wandering from pond to pond, one cannot find a flock of swans who live in lake Mansarover and an egret who kills living beings for food cannot be contemplating.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨੁ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ ਸੇਵ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕ ਹੁੲਿ ਮਾਖੀ ਤਿਅਾਗਿ ਚੰਦਨ ਦੁਰਗੰਧ ਅਸਥਾਨ ਹੈ ||੪੬੦||
transliteration: Binu Gurdayv Sayv Aan Dayv Sayvak Hui , Maakhee Tiaagi Chandan Duragandh Asadaan Hai ?460?
translation: Similarly, without the service of perfect Guru, if someone becomes a follower of any other god/goddess, it is like a fly who giving up the fragrance of sandalwood goes and sits on foul smelling filth.  (460)
